newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Banco Safra denies interest in Brazil's Bamerindus.
newsitem.headline: Banco Safra denies interest in Brazil's Bamerindus.

text.p: Private Brazilian bank Banco Safra denied press reports that it is interested in acquiring control of private bank Bamerindus.
"There is no truth (in these reports). There are no talks being held to acquire Bamerindus," said Carlos Alberto Vieira, Banco Safra's president.
Local press reports said Safra was studying the purchase of the bank.
In recent months, Bamerindus, Brazil's fourth-largest private bank, has been plagued by speculation that it would be sold due to its liquidity troubles.

On Tuesday, Bamerindus released its first half results, showing it returned to the black with a 20.4 million real net profit, but it lost 1.585 billion reais in total deposits and had 3.04 billion reais more in current liabilities than assets in the period.
Bamerindus recognized the liquidity problems and said it was considering two alternatives to improve liquidity: the sale of holdings or a central bank loan backed by its own assets.
